content.description: Boulder up through the first two clips to a cool undercling flake and the crux at the third clip. Fun jug-hauling through the last clip to the chains.
content.location: Climbs the far left end of the Bastard Wall right next to the big eroded dike. The last climb before you reach the Dike Wall.

content.description: A partially bolted open project up the bulging overhang. Looks very difficult. 2 bolts up high to anchors.
content.location: Starts just left of the sunny alcove in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Burly climbing with some big pulls up through the steepest terrain near the middle of the wall. Stick clip first bolt. 4 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Starts just right of the sunny alcove in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Climb up the black and white streaked face 2 bolts to the roof. Climb out the roof into a jug on the overhang above. Clip the third bolt and make some hard pulls to the anchors.
content.location: Climbs the obvious black and white streaks under the roof.

content.description: One of the easiest routes at Bald Bluff, this makes a good warmup for routes at the Lower Dike and the South Wall. Climbs flakes and jugs on gently overhung to vertical terrain to an awkward crux move at the 5th bolt. Rest at a stance then fire up the final headwall to anchors.
content.location: The left most route on the Bastard Wall. Start at the base of the short slope that leads up to the bottom of the Dike Wall.

content.description: Climb up the slab to a small ledge. Thin face moves past the 2nd bolt to the roof. Pull the roof onto the overhang above and finish to the anchors. 4 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Rightmost route on the wall. The approach trail dumps you right at the base of this climb.

content.description: Short and steep! This is the first wall you come to at the end of the approach trail. The wall heats up in the sun so be prepared to get cooked on warm days.
